Sentencas: A high temperature gradient within a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stack is considered a major challenge in SOFC operations.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: This study investigates the effects of the key parameters on SOFC system efficiency and temperature gradient within a SOFC stack.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: A 40- cell SOFC stack integrated with a bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reformer is simulated using MATLAB and DETCHEM.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: When the air-to-fuel ratio and steam-to-fuel ratio increase, the stack average temperature and temperature gradient decrease.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: However, a decrease in the stack temperature steadily reduces the system efficiency owing to the tradeoff between the stack performance and thermal balance between heat recovered and consumed by the system.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: With an increase in the bio-oil flow rate, the system efficiency decreases because of the lower resident time for the electrochemical reaction.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: This is not, however, beneficial to the maximum temperature gradient.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: To minimize the temperature gradient of the SOFC stack, a decrease in the bio-oil flow rate is the most effective way.
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming

Sentencas: The maximum temperature gradient can be reduced to 14.6 K cm(-1) with the stack and system efficiency of 76.58 and 65.18%, respectively, when the SOFC system is operated at an air-to-fuel ratio of 8, steam-to-fuel ratio of 6, and bio-oil flow rate of 0.0041 mol s(-1).
Titulo: Performance analysis and temperature gradient of solid oxide fuel cell stacks operated with bio-oil sorption-enhanced steam reforming
